p: Yang, M. et al. [ 248] reported an antiviral activity of curcumin against norovirus in a specific cell culture infection model. In particular, this compound was able to reduce the infectivity of norovirus by 91%. In a recent study, [ 249] showed that curcumin promoted the blockade of APE1-mediated redox function, and that through this mechanism it was able to inhibit the replication of herpesvirus (KSHV) associated with Kaposiâ€™s sarcoma. Prasad and coworkers (2015) in a review article reported many scientific evidences that Curcumin was effective in multiple steps of HIV infection and multiplication [ 250].
